sentences.en: " Yes, he has. With every advance, our numbers dwindle. "
sentences.cn: “ 不, 他赢了. 他每前进一步, 我们的人数量就减少了. ”

sentences.en: Allowing one axis of the ellipse to dwindle to zero, the crack limIt'solution is obtained.
sentences.cn: 将椭圆一轴缩小到零, 得到了裂纹情况的位错象力.

sentences.en: As gym classes dwindle, can kids keep fit?
sentences.cn: 健身课减少了, 孩子们怎么保持健康?

sentences.en: Bribery has begun to dwindle since the OECD convention, says Transparency International, a pressure group.
sentences.cn: 压力团体“透明国际(TransparencyInternational)”表示,自从缔结“经合组织合约”之后, 贿赂已经开始减少.

sentences.en: Females become rare, causing fewer young dinosaurs to be born and species to dwindle to extinction.
sentences.cn: 雌性恐龙变得非常稀少, 导致越来越少幼恐龙的出生,以致这个物种数量日渐稀少,直至灭绝.

sentences.en: His money dwindle away to nothing while traveling in europe.
sentences.cn: 在游欧期间,他花光了所有的钱.

sentences.en: Savings will begin to dwindle as retirees run them down.
sentences.cn: 退休人员会使中国的储蓄率开始下降.

sentences.en: The minute you begin to forgive yourself, you start to dwindle.
sentences.cn: [人都是在原谅自己的那一分钟开始懈怠. ]

sentences.en: The number of people going to the cinema seems to dwindle steadily.
sentences.cn: 看电影的人数似乎在逐渐下降.

sentences.en: Your social invitations will 10 dwindle and your circle of friends will undoubtedly shrink.
sentences.cn: 你接到的社交类邀请就会减少,朋友圈也会越来越小.

trans.tran_en: to gradually become less and less or smaller and smaller
to gradually become less and less or smaller and smaller

trans.tran_cn: 减少，变小，缩小，衰落，变坏，退化
